bug.author: anirudhacharya
bug.summary: 'Take' operator should support non-zero axis values
bug.description: The current implementation of <denchmark-link:https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/api/python/symbol/symbol.html#mxnet.symbol.take>Take operator</denchmark-link> is incomplete. As mentioned in the documentation, It supports slicing along only axis=0 and in ‘clip’ mode. The operator is intended to support other negative and non-negative values for axis. THe current implementation of the operator needs to be modified to meet multiple axis values. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/piiswrong>@piiswrong</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/szha>@szha</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zheng-da>@zheng-da</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/haojin2>@haojin2</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/eric-haibin-lin>@eric-haibin-lin</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Supported in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/11326>#11326</denchmark-link> , can close once that is merged.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nswamy>@nswamy</denchmark-link> Could you please change the labels to "Feature Request"? I feel like that's a better description of this issue. Our team is tracking bugs so this kind of issue could be confusing for us.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/anirudhacharya>@anirudhacharya</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/11326>#11326</denchmark-link> has been merged, so this issue should be closed?
